Title: Quotation from Chairman Mao: All men must die, but death can vary in its significance. ...
Designer: Film Academy Red Picture Soldiers (电影学院红画兵)
Publisher: Renmin meishu chubanshe (人民美术出版社), Beijing
Notes: The rest of the Mao Quotation: "The ancient Chinese writer Sima Qian said, 'Though death befalls all men alike, it may be weightier than Mount Tai or lighter than a feather.' To die for the people is weightier than Mount Tai, but to work for the fascists and die for the exploiters and oppressors is lighter than a feather."The quote is from one of the "Three Constantly Read Articles", i.e., Serve the People, written in memory of Zhang Side.
